forecaster.strategy.transaction.strategy module¶

Provides Strategy-type wrappers for TransactionTraversal.

class forecaster.strategy.transaction.strategy.TransactionStrategy(strategy, weights, debt_strategy=None, high_interest_threshold=None)[source]¶

Bases: forecaster.strategy.base.Strategy

Determines transactions to/from a group of accounts.

This is simply a convenient wrapper for TransactionTraversal. It generates a suitable priority tree based on the selected strategy and then traverses the tree to generate transactions for the accounts.

strategy¶

Either a string corresponding to a particular strategy or an instance of the strategy itself. See strategies for acceptable keys.

Type

str, func

strategies¶

{str, func} pairs where each key identifies a strategy (in human-readable text) and each value is a function with the same arguments and return value as transactions(). See its documentation for more info.

Acceptable keys include:

  • “TODO”

  • “TODO”

Type

dict

debt_strategy¶

A key in DebtPayment.strategies. Strategies will prioritize debts according to this strategy. See DebtPaymentStrategy for more information.

Type

str

high_interest_threshold¶

Debt accounts with this rate of interest or greater will be considered high-interest and those with lower interest rates will be considered low-interest. Some strategies use this division to determine which debts to prioritize ahead of investments.

Optional. If not provided, all debts are considered high-interest.

Type

Decimal

Parameters

available (dict[float, Money]) – The amounts to be contributed to (or withdrawn from, if negative) the accounts, as a mapping of {timing: value} pairs.

Returns

A mapping of accounts to transactions.

Return type

dict[Account, dict[Decimal, Money]]

__call__(available, accounts, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Returns a dict of account: transaction pairs.

__init__(strategy, weights, debt_strategy=None, high_interest_threshold=None)[source]¶

Init TransactionStrategy.

debt_priority(debts)[source]¶

Converts a collection of debts into a priority tree.

This method uses the selected priority method (e.g. avalanche_priority, snowball_priority) to convert debts into a priority tree.

Arg:

debt (set[Debt]): Debts to organize into a priority tree.

Returns

An ordered list of Debt objects, with the order determined according to debt_strategy. This is a simple priority tree that can be embedded into a larger tree.

Return type

list[Debt]

divide_debts(accounts)[source]¶

Separates high- and low-interest debts.

Parameters

accounts (Iterable[Account]) – A collection of accounts, which may or may not contain any Debt members.

Returns

All Debt-type accounts in accounts with outstanding balances, as a (low_interest, high_interest) tuple.

Return type

tuple[frozenset[Account], frozenset[Account]]

strategies = {'Ordered': <function TransactionStrategy.strategy_ordered>, 'Weighted': <function TransactionStrategy.strategy_weighted>}
strategy_ordered(groups, *args, subtrees=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Generates a priority tree with ordered accounts.

This strategy treats the values of TransactionStrategy.weights as ordinals. The key with the lowest value (usually 1) are first in the order, followed by the next-lowest key.

This method does not translate the keys of TransactionStrategy.weights into accounts. That should be done in advance, so that groups contains only sets of accounts mapped to weights. Each group should have a unique weight, otherwise the behaviour is undefined. _This method will fail if groups contains a type object!_

Where multiple accounts are mapped to a given weight (by being contained by the same group), they will be added to the priority tree as a weighted node. That node will be nested within an ordered tree.

Parameters

  • groups (dict[frozenset[Account], Decimal]) – Sets of accounts mapped to the order (i.e. weight) associated with the set of accounts. Weights should be unique, otherwise behaviour is undefined.

  • subtrees (dict[frozenset[Account], Any]) – Maps groups to priority trees. If a given group is in subtrees, the corresponding value in subtrees will be inserted into the priority tree instead of whatever this method would ordinarily generate (e.g. an equal-weighted dict).

Returns

An ordered priority tree, potentially with nested priority trees of arbitrary form (if provided by subtrees, otherwise all nested trees are equal-weighted dicts).

Return type

list((TransactionNode, list[Any], dict[Any]))

strategy_weighted(groups, *args, subtrees=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Generates a priority tree with ordered accounts.

This strategy treats the values of TransactionStrategy.weights as proportional weights. Each group will receive its associated weight. Weights do not need to be unique between groups.

This method does not translate the keys of TransactionStrategy.weights into accounts. That should be done in advance, so that groups contains only sets of accounts mapped to weights. _This method will fail if groups contains a type object!_

Where multiple accounts are mapped to a given weight (by being contained by the same group), they will be added to the priority tree as a weighted node. That node will be nested within a weighted tree.

Parameters

  • groups (dict[frozenset[Account], Decimal]) – Sets of accounts mapped to the weight associated with the set.

  • subtrees (dict[frozenset[Account], Any]) – Maps groups to priority trees. If a given group is in subtrees, the corresponding value in subtrees will be inserted into the priority tree instead of whatever this method would ordinarily generate (e.g. an equal-weighted dict).

Returns

A weighted priority tree, potentially with nested priority trees of arbitrary form (if provided by subtrees, otherwise all nested trees are equal-weighted dicts).

Return type

dict((TransactionNode, list[Any], dict[Any]), Decimal)
